question.questionText: Explain why you got a voltage reading of 1.5 for terminal 1 and the positive terminal.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Terminal 1 and the positive terminal are separated by the gap
Terminal 1 and the positive terminal are not connected
terminal 1 is connected to the negative battery terminal
terminal 1 is not separated from the negative battery terminal
terminal 1 and the positive battery terminal are in different electrical states

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: there is a gap between terminal 1 and the positive terminal
Terminal 1 is not connected to the positive battery terminal.
The positive terminal has a 1.5 V charge and terminal one has a 0.00 V
There was a gap between terminal 1 and the positive terminal.
the bulb isnt connected to the positive battery terminal
Terminal 1 is connected to the positive terminal.
because the meter measures the difference between the two terminals
because terminal 1 is connected to the negative battery terminal
the leads of the voltmeter were reversed. therefore, the voltages were also reversed.
because you are measuring the + current
Because terminal 1 is connected to the negative battery terminal.
Because the voltage of the battery on the closed circuit is the same as the batterys original voltage.
Because terminal 1 was connected to the negative terminal of the battery
